synopsis.text:
In the vibrant world of children's television, 'Together with Mama' is a beacon of joy and learning for young minds. But behind the scenes, the show's hosts grapple with the harsh realities of adulthood. At the heart of this dichotomy is Uramichi Omota, the show's 31-year-old gymnastics coach. With a cheerful exterior that barely conceals his emotional turmoil, Uramichi struggles to maintain his composure while teaching life lessons to his young audience.

Flanked by a pair of mascots and a singing duo, Uramichi navigates the treacherous waters of adult life, often blurting out his existential despair in front of the rolling cameras. His coworkers, each with their own set of adult problems, add to the chaotic mix of the show. From Utano Tadano, the singer desperate to get married, to Iketeru Daga, the handsome man with a crass sense of humor, everyone on 'Together with Mama' is fighting their own battles.

Despite the dark undertones, the show must go on. And so, Uramichi and his colleagues continue to entertain and educate their young audience, all while grappling with the harsh realities of adulthood. 'Life Lessons with Uramichi Oniisan' is a poignant exploration of the human condition, wrapped in the guise of a children's show. It's a dark comedy that will leave you laughing and contemplating the complexities of life.
